who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

40.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

41.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
rescue (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

42.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
David, the youngest son of Jesse
